NPR.text: Plenty of research has found COVID vaccines to be safe and effective. But anti-vaccine activists are mischaracterizing government data to imply the shots are dangerous. https://t.co/5RbI1ZJROs

The country's largest database for detecting events that might be vaccine side-effects is being mischaracterized and taken out of context by anti-vaccine groups to spread disinformation about COVID shots. https://t.co/o6fij3cLgv

A new type of COVID-19 vaccine is 100% effective against the original coronavirus strain, and 93% effective against variants, manufacturer Novavax reports. All cases in which variants caused breakthrough infections resulted in mild symptoms. https://t.co/b0K2L3sO9v

A new program in Washington state is offering adults a free, pre-rolled joint when they get vaccinated against COVID-19. It's one of several vaccination incentive programs the state has rolled out. https://t.co/9jSPLx7s9v

Steven Brandenburg, the admitted conspiracy theorist and ex-pharmacist who intentionally destroyed 500 vaccine doses, was sentenced to 3 years in prison this week. He said in a statement that he felt "great shame." https://t.co/COKqeMSwto

A Houston hospital system suspended 178 workers for not meeting their deadline to get vaccinated against COVID-19. Now 117 employees have filed a lawsuit, spearheaded by a conservative activist. https://t.co/TpVnMAO5mo
The cost of buying a fake vaccine card online — $12.99. The cost of actually getting a COVID vaccine and a legitimate vaccination card — free. https://t.co/ae7mdGYrop

Johnson & Johnson says U.S. regulators have extended the expiration date on millions of doses of its COVID-19 vaccine by 6 weeks, giving the shots a safe and effective shelf life of at least 4 1/2 months. https://t.co/ip9fRWH6UB
